title: The formation and transport of HNO3 over the Yellow Sea and its impact on the January 2018 PM2.5 episode in Seoul
content:
Environ. Sci.: Atmos., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EA00034J, Paper
Open Access
Â  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial 3.0 Unported Licence.
Hyeon-Yeong Park, Joon-Young Ahn, Sung-Chul Hong, Jae-Bum Lee, Seog-Yeon Cho
Our analysis of monitoring data and simulations showed that particulate nitrate is a major contributor to PM pollution in Seoul. NO2 emitted from China travelled across the Yellow Sea and transformed into HNO3 during the night, resulting in a substantial formation of particulate nitrates in Seoul.
